Path: README.md
 1	# Front
 2	
 3	This project was generated using [Angular CLI](https://github.com/angular/angular-cli) version 20.0.0.
 4	
 5	## Development server
 6	
 7	To start a local development server, run:
 8	
 9	```bash
 10	ng serve
 11	```
 12	
 13	Once the server is running, open your browser and navigate to `http://localhost:4200/`. The application will automatically reload whenever you modify any of the source files.
 14	
 15	## Code scaffolding
 16	
 17	Angular CLI includes powerful code scaffolding tools. To generate a new component, run:
 18	
 19	```bash
 20	ng generate component component-name
 21	```
 22	
 23	For a complete list of available schematics (such as `components`, `directives`, or `pipes`), run:
 24	
 25	```bash
 26	ng generate --help
 27	```
 28	
 29	## Building
 30	
 31	To build the project run:
 32	
 33	```bash
 34	ng build
 35	```
 36	
 37	This will compile your project and store the build artifacts in the `dist/` directory. By default, the production build optimizes your application for performance and speed.
 38	
 39	## Running unit tests
 40	
 41	To execute unit tests with the [Karma](https://karma-runner.github.io) test runner, use the following command:
 42	
 43	```bash
 44	ng test
 45	```
 46	
 47	## Running end-to-end tests
 48	
 49	For end-to-end (e2e) testing, run:
 50	
 51	```bash
 52	ng e2e
 53	```
 54	
 55	Angular CLI does not come with an end-to-end testing framework by default. You can choose one that suits your needs.
 56	
 57	## Additional Resources
 58	
 59	For more information on using the Angular CLI, including detailed command references, visit the [Angular CLI Overview and Command Reference](https://angular.dev/tools/cli) page.

Path: src/app/modules/openapi/README.md
 1	# @
 2	
 3	Backend APIs for E-Commerce app
 4	
 5	The version of the OpenAPI document: v1.0.0
 6	
 7	## Building
 8	
 9	To install the required dependencies and to build the typescript sources run:
 10	
 11	```console
 12	npm install
 13	npm run build
 14	```
 15	
 16	## Publishing
 17	
 18	First build the package then run `npm publish dist` (don't forget to specify the `dist` folder!)
 19	
 20	## Consuming
 21	
 22	Navigate to the folder of your consuming project and run one of next commands.
 23	
 24	_published:_
 25	
 26	```console
 27	npm install @ --save
 28	```
 29	
 30	_without publishing (not recommended):_
 31	
 32	```console
 33	npm install PATH_TO_GENERATED_PACKAGE/dist.tgz --save
 34	```
 35	
 36	_It's important to take the tgz file, otherwise you'll get trouble with links on windows_
 37	
 38	_using `npm link`:_
 39	
 40	In PATH_TO_GENERATED_PACKAGE/dist:
 41	
 42	```console
 43	npm link
 44	```
 45	
 46	In your project:
 47	
 48	```console
 49	npm link 
 50	```
 51	
 52	__Note for Windows users:__ The Angular CLI has troubles to use linked npm packages.
 53	Please refer to this issue <https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/8284> for a solution / workaround.
 54	Published packages are not effected by this issue.
 55	
 56	### General usage
 57	
 58	In your Angular project:
 59	
 60	```typescript
 61	// without configuring providers
 62	import { ApiModule } from '';
 63	import { HttpClientModule } from '@angular/common/http';
 64	
 65	@NgModule({
 66	 imports: [
 67	 ApiModule,
 68	 // make sure to import the HttpClientModule in the AppModule only,
 69	 // see https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/20575
 70	 HttpClientModule
 71	 ],
 72	 declarations: [ AppComponent ],
 73	 providers: [],
 74	 bootstrap: [ AppComponent ]
 75	})
...
 130	```
 131	
 132	Note: The ApiModule is restricted to being instantiated once app wide.
 133	This is to ensure that all services are treated as singletons.
 134	
 135	### Using multiple OpenAPI files / APIs / ApiModules
 136	
 137	In order to use multiple `ApiModules` generated from different OpenAPI files,
 138	you can create an alias name when importing the modules
 139	in order to avoid naming conflicts:
 140	
 141	```typescript
 142	import { ApiModule } from 'my-api-path';
 143	import { ApiModule as OtherApiModule } from 'my-other-api-path';
 144	import { HttpClientModule } from '@angular/common/http';
 145	
 146	@NgModule({
 147	 imports: [
 148	 ApiModule,
 149	 OtherApiModule,
 150	 // make sure to import the HttpClientModule in the AppModule only,
 151	 // see https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/20575
 152	 HttpClientModule
 153	 ]
 154	})
...
 183	export class AppModule {}
 184	```
 185	
 186	### Using @angular/cli
 187	
 188	First extend your `src/environments/*.ts` files by adding the corresponding base path:
 189	
 190	```typescript
 191	export const environment = {
 192	 production: false,
 193	 API_BASE_PATH: 'http://127.0.0.1:8080'
 194	};
 195	```
 196	
 197	In the src/app/app.module.ts:
 198	
 199	```typescript
 200	import { BASE_PATH } from '';
 201	import { environment } from '../environments/environment';
 202	
 203	@NgModule({
 204	 declarations: [
 205	 AppComponent
 206	 ],
 207	 imports: [ ],
 208	 providers: [{ provide: BASE_PATH, useValue: environment.API_BASE_PATH }],
 209	 bootstrap: [ AppComponent ]
 210	})
...
 232	```

 1	# Getting Started
 2	
 3	### Reference Documentation
 4	For further reference, please consider the following sections:
 5	
 6	* [Official Apache Maven documentation](https://maven.apache.org/guides/index.html)
 7	* [Spring Boot Maven Plugin Reference Guide](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/maven-plugin)
 8	* [Create an OCI image](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/maven-plugin/build-image.html)
 9	* [Spring Web](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/web/servlet.html)
 10	* [Spring Data JPA](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/data/sql.html#data.sql.jpa-and-spring-data)
 11	* [Spring Security](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/web/spring-security.html)
 12	* [Spring Boot Actuator](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/actuator/index.html)
 13	* [Spring Boot DevTools](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/using/devtools.html)

 28	### Maven Parent overrides
 29	
 30	Due to Maven's design, elements are inherited from the parent POM to the project POM.
 31	While most of the inheritance is fine, it also inherits unwanted elements like `<license>` and `<developers>` from the parent.
 32	To prevent this, the project POM contains empty overrides for these elements.
 33	If you manually switch to a different parent and actually want the inheritance, you need to remove those overrides.

## User Features

- Sign up: Users can sign up for a new account by providing their personal information,
 such as name, email address, password, phone number, personal address, birthdate and credit limit.

- Sign in: Users can sign in to their accounts using their email address and password (with lostpassword funcitonality).[25;1H

- Edit profile: Users can edit their profile information, such as name, personal address,
 phone number, birthdate, credit limit.

- Browse products: Users can browse our products and add them to their cart.

- Add to cart: Users can add products to their cart by clicking the "Add to Cart" button.


- Edit cart: Users can edit the quantity of products in their cart or remove products from their cart.

- Add to wishlist
- Edit withlist

- Buy products: Users can buy products using either cash or credit with proper validation checks in crdit limit and inve
[24;120Hentory.

## Admin Features

- Add products: Admins can add new products to the website, including the product name, product category, description, p
[24;120Hprice, discount and image.

- Edit products: Admins can edit the details of existing products.

- Add categories: Admins can add new categories to the website, including the product name, product category, descriptio
[24;120Hon, price, discount and image.

- Edit categories: Admins can edit the details of existing products.
-
- View products: Admins can view a list of all products on the website with nice paginated and filtering and sorting vie

- Review customers: Admins can view a list of all registered customers and their personal information with nice paginate
[24;120Hed and filtering and sorting view.

Design PatternsProject Analysis: EComUs E-Commerce Application
Project Structure
The project follows a standard Spring Boot application structure:
Architecture
The application follows a layered architecture:
Presentation Layer (Controllers)
Handles HTTP requests and responses
Input validation
Authentication and authorization
Business Layer (Services)
Core business logic
Transaction management
Domain rules enforcement
Data Access Layer (Repositories)
Database interactions
Query execution
Data persistence
Cross-Cutting Concerns
Security
Logging
Exception handling
Caching
Design Patterns
Repository Pattern
Abstracts data access logic
Spring Data JPA repositories
Specification Pattern
Dynamic query building for filtering products, orders, etc.
ProductSpecification, CartSpecification classes
DTO Pattern
Separates API contracts from domain models
Prevents entity exposure
Builder Pattern
Used in entity and DTO creation
Example: Order.builder() in OrderCreationService
Dependency Injection
Spring's core IoC container
Constructor and field injection
Strategy Pattern
Payment processing strategies
Image storage strategies
Factory Pattern
Creating complex objects
Example: PagingAndSortingHelper
Adapter Pattern
Integration with external services
Example: ImageStorageClient
Technologies Used
Core Framework
Spring Boot 3.5.0
Java 21
Security
Spring Security
JWT Authentication
Role-based access control
Database
MySQL
JPA/Hibernate
Flyway for migrations
Caching
EhCache
JCache API
Hibernate second-level cache
API Documentation
OpenAPI/Swagger
Custom Swagger UI configuration
Storage
Azure Blob Storage
Local file system fallback
Validation
Jakarta Bean Validation
Custom validators
Object Mapping
MapStruct for entity-DTO conversion
Asynchronous Processing
CompletableFuture
Custom thread pools
Async image uploads
Logging
SLF4J
Logback
Key Features
Product Management
CRUD operations
Category management
Image handling
User Management

Profile management
Shopping Cart

Order Processing

Advanced Search
Dynamic filtering
Pagination
Sorting
Wishlist Management
Save products for later
Move to cart
Payment Processing
Multiple payment methods
Credit limit validation
Design Patterns Used:
Repository Pattern: Spring Data JPA abstraction
Specification Pattern: Dynamic filtering (e.g., ProductSpecification)
DTO Pattern: API contracts, prevent entity exposure
Builder Pattern: Order.builder() style creation
Dependency Injection: Spring IoC (constructor/field)
Strategy Pattern: Payment/Image handling
Factory Pattern: Object creation (e.g., PagingAndSortingHelper)
Adapter Pattern: External integrations (e.g., ImageStorageClient)
# Technologies Used
Our website uses the following technologies:

## Frontend
- angular 20 / guards/ interceptors for jwt token /rxjc

## Backend
Core:
Spring Boot 3.5.0, Java 21
Security:
Spring Security, JWT, role-based access
DB:
MySQL, JPA/Hibernate, Flyway
Caching:
EhCache, JCache, Hibernate L2 cache
Docs & Validation:
OpenAPI/Swagger (custom UI), Jakarta Validation
Storage:
Azure Blob + local fallback
Mapping & Async:
MapStruct, CompletableFuture
Logging:
SLF4J, Logback

Modern E-Commerce Platform\n\n[![Angular](https://img.shields.io/badge/Angular-20.0.0-red?style=flat-square&logo=angular)](https://angular.io/)\n[![Spring Boot](https://img.shields.io/badge/Spring%20Boot-3.5.0-brightgreen?style=flat-square&logo=spring)](https://spring.io/projects/spring-boot)\n[![Java](https://img.shields.io/badge/Java-21-orange?style=flat-square&logo=openjdk)](https://openjdk.org/)\n[![MySQL](https://img.shields.io/badge/MySQL-8.0-blue?style=flat-square&logo=mysql)](https://www.mysql.com/)\n[![Docker](https://img.shields.io/badge/Docker-Enabled-blue?style=flat-square&logo=docker)](https://www.docker.com/)\n[![License](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-yellow?style=flat-square)](LICENSE)\n\n> A comprehensive, full-stack e-commerce platform built as an ITI graduation project, featuring modern web technologies and enterprise-grade architecture.\n\n## \ud83d\ude80 Overview\n\nEComUs is a sophisticated e-commerce platform that delivers a complete online shopping experience. Built with cutting-edge technologies, it combines a responsive Angular frontend with a robust Spring Boot backend, offering everything from product browsing to order management with advanced filtering, pagination, and personalization features.\n\n### \u2728 What Makes EComUs Special\n\n- **Modern Architecture**: Full-stack application with clean separation of concerns\n- **Enterprise Features**: Advanced filtering, pagination, sorting, and caching\n- **Secure & Scalable**: JWT authentication, role-based access control, and cloud storage\n- **Developer-Friendly**: Comprehensive API documentation, Docker support, and automated testing\n- **Production-Ready**: Optimized performance with second-level caching and async processing\n\n---\n\n## \ud83d\udc65 Meet Our Team\n\nThis project was crafted with passion by a talented team of developers:\n\n| Developer | GitHub Profile | Role |\n|-----------|----------------|------|\n| **Abdelrahman Abouelsherbini** | [@abdelrahman-sherbini](https://github.com/abdelrahman-sherbini) | Frontend Lead |\n| **Ahmed Ashraf** | [@AhmedAshraf8228](https://github.com/AhmedAshraf8228) | Backend Developer |\n| **Amina Emad** | [@amina836](https://github.com/amina836) | Full-Stack Developer |\n| **Menna Allah Yasser** | [@Menna-Allah-Yasser](https://github.com/Menna-Allah-Yasser) | Backend Lead |\n| **Hazim Karam** | [@Hazim-Karam159](https://github.com/Hazim-Karam159) | DevOps & Testing |\n\n---\n\n## \ud83c\udfaf Features & Capabilities"}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Now I have a comprehensive understanding of the project.  7	## Building
 8	
 9	To install the required dependencies and to build the typescript sources run:
 10	
 11	```console
 12	npm install
 13	npm run build
 14	```
 15	
 16	## Publishing
 17	
 18	First build the package then run `npm publish dist` (don't forget to specify the `dist` folder!)
 19	
 20	## Consuming
 21	
 22	Navigate to the folder of your consuming project and run one of next commands.
 23	
 24	_published:_
 25	
 26	```console
 27	npm install @ --save
 28	```
 29	
 30	_without publishing (not recommended):_
 31	
 32	```console
 33	npm install PATH_TO_GENERATED_PACKAGE/dist.tgz --save
 34	```
 35	
 36	_It's important to take the tgz file, otherwise you'll get trouble with links on windows_
 37	
 38	_using `npm link`:_
 39	
 40	In PATH_TO_GENERATED_PACKAGE/dist:
 41	
 42	```console
 43	npm link
 44	```

filtering, pagination, and personalization features.\n\n### \u2728 What Makes EComUs Special\n\n- **Modern Architecture**: Full-stack application with clean separation of concerns\n- **Enterprise | [@amina836](https://github.com/amina836) | Full-Stack Developer |\n| **Menna Allah Yasser** | [@Menna-Allah-Yasser](https://github.com/Menna-Allah-Yasser) | Backend Lead |\n| **Hazim Karam** | [@Hazim-Karam159](https://github.com/Hazim-Karam159) | DevOps & Testing |\n\n---\n\n## \ud83c\udfaf Features & Capabilities\n\n### \ud83d\udecd\ufe0f Customer Experience\n\n**Account Management**\n- **Seamless Registration**: Quick signup with comprehensive profile creation including personal details, addresses, and credit limits\n- **Secure Authentication**: JWT-based login system with password recovery functionality\n- **Profile Customization**: Edit personal information, manage addresses, and update preferences\n\n**Shopping Experience**\n- **Intuitive Product Browsing**: Explore products with advanced search, filtering, and sorting capabilities\n- **Smart Shopping Cart**: Add, modify quantities, and remove items with real-time price calculations\n- **Wishlist Management**: Save favorite products and easily move them to cart\n- **Personalized Homepage**: Customized product recommendations based on browsing history\n\n**Order Management**\n- **Flexible Payment Options**: Support for both cash and credit payments with validation\n- **Order Tracking**: Real-time order status updates from placement to delivery\n- **Purchase History**: Complete order history with detailed transaction records\n\n### \ud83d\udd27 Administrative Control\n\n**Product Management**\n- **Comprehensive Product Catalog**: Add, edit, and manage products with detailed descriptions, pricing, and images\n- **Category Organization**: Create and manage product categories with hierarchical structure\n- **Inventory Control**: Track stock levels and manage product availability\n- **Bulk Operations**: Efficient management of multiple products simultaneously\n\n**Customer Relations**\n- **User Management**: View and manage customer accounts with detailed profiles\n- **Advanced Analytics**: Comprehensive filtering, pagination, and sorting for customer data\n- **Communication Tools**: Integrated email system for customer notifications\n\n**Order Administration**\n- **Order Processing**: View, update, and manage order statuses throughout the fulfillment process\n- **Sales Analytics**: Detailed reporting and analytics for business insights\n- **Payment Verification**: Monitor and validate payment transactions\n\n---\n\n## \ud83c\udfd7\ufe0f Technology Stack\n\n### Frontend Technologies\n- **Framework**: Angular 20.0.0 with standalone components\n- **UI/UX**: Bootstrap 5.3.6 with Bootstrap Icons\n- **State Management**: RxJS for reactive programming\n- **Charts & Analytics**: Chart.js for data visualization\n- **Build Tools**: Angular CLI with optimized production builds\n\n### Backend Technologies\n- **Core Framework**: Spring Boot 3.5.0 with Java 21\n- **Security**: Spring Security with JWT authentication and OAuth2\n- **Database**: MySQL 8.0 with JPA/Hibernate ORM\n- **Caching**: EhCache with Hibernate second-level cache\n- **API Documentation**: OpenAPI 3.0 with Swagger UI\n\n### Cloud & DevOps\n- **Storage**: Azure Blob Storage with local fallback\n- **Containerization**: Docker with multi-stage builds\n- **Database Migration**: Flyway for version control\n- **Email Service**: Spring Mail with SMTP configuration\n\n### Development Tools\n- **Code Generation**: OpenAPI Generator for TypeScript client\n- **Object Mapping**: MapStruct for entity-DTO conversion\n- **Testing**: JUnit, Karma, and Jasmine\n- **Build Automation**: Maven and npm scripts\n\n---\n\n## \ud83c\udfdb\ufe0f Architecture & Design Patterns\n\nEComUs follows enterprise-grade architectural principles and implements proven design patterns:\n\n### Architectural Layers\n- **Presentation Layer**: Angular components with reactive forms and guards\n- **API Layer**: RESTful controllers with comprehensive validation\n- **Business Layer**: Service classes with transaction management\n- **Data Layer**: JPA repositories with specification pattern\n\n### Design Patterns Implemented\n- **Repository Pattern**: Clean data access abstraction\n- **Specification Pattern**: Dynamic query building for complex filtering\n- **DTO Pattern**: API contract separation from domain models\n- **Builder Pattern**: Fluent object creation\n- **Strategy Pattern**: Flexible payment and storage implementations\n- **Dependency Injection**: Spring IoC container for loose coupling\n\n---\n\n## \ud83d\ude80 Quick Start\n\n### Prerequisites\n- **Java 21** or higher\n- **Node.js 20** or higher\n- **MySQL 8.0** or higher\n- **Docker** (optional, for containerized deployment)\n\n### Local Development Setup\n\n1. **Clone the Repository**\n ```bash\n git clone https://github.com/your-org/ITI-Ecommerce-Graduation.git\n cd ITI-Ecommerce-Graduation\n ```\n\n2. **Backend Setup**\n ```bash\n # Navigate to backend directory\n cd backend\n \n # Configure database connection in application.properties\n # Update MySQL credentials and connection string\n \n # Run the Spring Boot application\n ./mvnw spring-boot:run\n ```\n\n3. **Frontend Setup**\n ```bash\n # Navigate to frontend directory\n cd front\n \n # Install dependencies\n npm install\n \n # Start development server\n npm start\n ```\n\n4. **Access the Application**\n - Frontend: http://localhost:4200\n - Backend API: http://localhost:8080\n - API Documentation: http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui.html\n\n### Docker Deployment\n\nFor a complete containerized setup:\n\n```bash\n# Start all services with Docker Compose\ndocker-compose up -d\n\n# View logs\ndocker-compose logs -f\n\n# Stop services\ndocker-compose down\n```\n\n---\n\n## \ud83d\udcda API Documentation\n\nOur API is fully documented using OpenAPI 3.0 specification. Access the interactive documentation at:\n\n- **Swagger UI**: http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui.html\n- **OpenAPI JSON**: http://localhost:8080/v3/api-docs\n\n### Key API Endpoints\n\n| Endpoint | Method | Description |\n|----------|--------|-------------|\n| `/api/public/products` | GET | Browse products with filtering |\n| `/api/public/categories` | GET | Get product categories |\n| `/api/auth/login` | POST | User authentication |\n| `/api/auth/register` | POST | User registration |\n| `/api/user/cart` | GET/POST | Shopping cart operations |\n| `/api/user/orders` | GET/POST | Order management |\n| `/api/admin/products` | GET/POST/PUT/DELETE | Product administration |\n\n---\n\n## \ud83e\uddea Testing\n\n### Running Tests\n\n**Backend Tests**\n```bash\ncd backend\n./mvnw test\n```\n\n**Frontend Tests**\n```bash\ncd front\nnpm test\n```\n\n**End-to-End Tests**\n```bash\ncd front\nnpm run e2e\n```\n\n---\n\n## \ud83e\udd1d Contributing\n\nWe welcome contributions! IF MORE CONTENT NEEDS TO BE ADDED USE THE str-replace-editor TOOL TO EDIT THE FILE AFTER IT HAS BEEN CREATED.", "path": "README_new.md", "file_content": "# EComUs - E-Commerce Platform\n\n![Angular](https://img.shields.io/badge/Angular-20.0.0-red)\n![Spring Boot](https://img.shields.io/badge/Spring%20Boot-3.5.0-brightgreen)\n![Java](https://img.shields.io/badge/Java-21-orange)\n![MySQL](https://img.shields.io/badge/MySQL-8.0-blue)\n\nAn e-commerce web application built as our graduation project for ITI. This is a full-stack online shopping platform with both customer and admin functionality.\n\n## About This Project\n\nWe built EComUs as our final project to demonstrate what we learned during our time at ITI. It's a complete e-commerce solution where users can browse products, manage their cart and wishlist, place orders, and admins can manage the entire system.\n\nThe project uses Angular for the frontend and Spring Boot for the backend, with features like user authentication, product filtering, order management, and more.\n\n## Team Members\n\n- [Abdelrahman Abouelsherbini](https://github.com/abdelrahman-sherbini)\n- [Ahmed Ashraf](https://github.com/AhmedAshraf8228)\n- [Amina Emad](https://github.com/amina836)\n- [Menna Allah Yasser](https://github.com/Menna-Allah-Yasser)\n- [Hazim Karam](https://github.com/Hazim-Karam159)\n\n## Features\n\n### For Customers\n- **User Registration & Login**: Create an account with email verification and password recovery\n- **Product Browsing**: Search and filter products by category, price, and other criteria\n- **Shopping Cart**: Add products, modify quantities, and manage your cart\n- **Wishlist**: Save products for later and move them to cart when ready\n- **Order Management**: Place orders with cash or credit payment options\n- **Profile Management**: Update personal information, addresses, and credit limits\n\n### For Admins\n- **Product Management**: Add, edit, and delete products with images and descriptions\n- **Category Management**: Organize products into categories\n- **User Management**: View and manage customer accounts\n- **Order Management**: Track and update order statuses\n- **Analytics**: View sales data and customer information with filtering and sorting\n\n## Tech Stack\n\n### Frontend\n- **Angular 20** - Main framework\n- **Bootstrap 5** - UI components and styling\n- **RxJS** - Reactive programming\n- **Chart.js** - Data visualization\n- **TypeScript** - Type-safe development\n\n### Backend\n- **Spring Boot 3.5** - Main framework\n- **Java 21** - Programming language\n- **Spring Security** - Authentication and authorization with JWT\n- **Spring Data JPA** - Database operations\n- **MySQL 8** - Database\n- **Flyway** - Database migrations\n- **EhCache** - Caching layer\n\n### Additional Tools\n- **Docker** - Containerization\n- **Azure Blob Storage** - Image storage\n- **OpenAPI/Swagger** - API documentation\n- **MapStruct** - Object mapping\n- **Maven** - Build tool for backend\n- **npm** - Package manager for frontend\n\n## Getting Started\n\n### Prerequisites\n- Java 21\n- Node.js 20+\n- MySQL 8\n- Docker (optional)\n\n### Running Locally\n\n1. **Clone the repository**\n ```bash\n git clone <repository-url>\n cd ITI-Ecommerce-Graduation\n ```\n\n2. **Set up the database**\n - Create a MySQL database named `ecomus`\n - Update database credentials in `src/main/resources/application.properties`\n\n3. **Run the backend**\n ```bash\n cd backend\n ./mvnw spring-boot:run\n ```\n\n4. **Run the frontend**\n ```bash\n cd front\n npm install\n npm start\n ```\n\n5. **Access the application**\n - Frontend: http://localhost:4200\n - Backend API: http://localhost:8080\n - API Documentation: http://localhost:8080/swagger-ui.html\n\n### Using Docker\n\nIf you prefer to use Docker:\n\n```bash\ndocker-compose up -d\n```\n\nThis will start all services including the database.\n\n## API Documentation\n\nThe API is documented using OpenAPI/Swagger. Once the backend is running, you can access the interactive documentation at:\nhttp://localhost:8080/swagger-ui.html\n\n## Project Structure\n\n```\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 backend/ # Spring Boot backend\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 front/ # Angular frontend\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 Docker-Compose.yaml\n\u251c\u2500\u2500 Dockerfile\n\u2514\u2500\u2500 README.md\n```\n\n## Key Features Implemented\n\n- **Authentication**: JWT-based login system with role-based access\n- **Product Catalog**: Complete product management with categories and images\n- **Shopping Cart**: Session-based cart management\n- **Order Processing**: Full order lifecycle from cart to delivery\n- **Admin Panel**: Comprehensive admin interface for managing the platform\n- **Search & Filtering**: Advanced product search with multiple filters\n- **Responsive Design**: Works on desktop and mobile devices\n- **Caching**: Optimized performance with EhCache\n- **File Upload**: Image upload for products with Azure Blob Storage\n\n## What We Learned\n\nThis project helped us practice and demonstrate:\n- Full-stack web development\n- RESTful API design\n- Database design and management\n- Authentication and authorization\n- Frontend-backend integration\n- Docker containerization\n- Cloud storage integration\n- Testing and debugging\n\n## Challenges We Faced\n\n- Integrating Angular with Spring Boot\n- Implementing secure authentication\n- Managing file uploads and storage\n- Setting up proper caching\n- Handling complex database relationships\n- Deploying with Docker\n\n## Future Improvements\n\nIf we continue working on this project, we'd like to add:\n- Payment gateway integration\n- Email notifications\n- Product reviews and ratings\n- Real-time chat support\n- Mobile app version\n- Advanced analytics dashboard\n\n## Contributing\n\nThis is a graduation project, but if you'd like to contribute or use it as a reference:\n\n1. Fork the repository\n2. Create a feature branch\n3. Make your changes\n4. Submit a pull request\n\n## License\n\nThis project is for educational purposes as part of our ITI graduation requirements.\n\n---\n\n**Note**: This is a student project created for learning purposes. Some features may not be production-ready."}","mcp_server_name":"","mcp_tool_name":""}},{"id":0,"type":0,"content":"Let me try a different approach and create a completely new README with a more natural tone:

 35	```

 1	# @
 2	
 3	Backend APIs for E-Commerce app
 4	
 5	The version of the OpenAPI document: v1.0.0
 6	
 7	## Building
 8	
 9	To install the required dependencies and to build the typescript sources run:
 10	
 11	```console
 12	npm install
 13	npm run build
 14	```
 15	
 16	## Publishing
 17	
 18	First build the package then run `npm publish dist` (don't forget to specify the `dist` folder!)
 19	
 20	## Consuming
 21	
 22	Navigate to the folder of your consuming project and run one of next commands.
 23	
 24	_published:_
 25	
 26	```console
 27	npm install @ --save
 28	```
 29	
 30	_without publishing (not recommended):_
 31	
 32	```console
 33	npm install PATH_TO_GENERATED_PACKAGE/dist.tgz --save
 34	```
 35	
 36	_It's important to take the tgz file, otherwise you'll get trouble with links on windows_
 37	
 38	_using `npm link`:_
 39	
 40	In PATH_TO_GENERATED_PACKAGE/dist:
 41	
 42	```console
 43	npm link
 44	```
 45	
 46	In your project:
 47	
 48	```console
 49	npm link 
 50	```
 51	
 52	__Note for Windows users:__ The Angular CLI has troubles to use linked npm packages.
 53	Please refer to this issue <https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/8284> for a solution / workaround.
 54	Published packages are not effected by this issue.
 55	
 56	### General usage
 57	
 58	In your Angular project:
 59	
 60	```typescript
 61	// without configuring providers
 62	import { ApiModule } from '';
 63	import { HttpClientModule } from '@angular/common/http';
 64	
 65	@NgModule({
 66	 imports: [
 67	 ApiModule,
 68	 // make sure to import the HttpClientModule in the AppModule only,
 69	 // see https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/20575
 70	 HttpClientModule
 71	 ],
 72	 declarations: [ AppComponent ],
 73	 providers: [],
 74	 bootstrap: [ AppComponent ]
 75	})
...
 130	```
 131	
 132	Note: The ApiModule is restricted to being instantiated once app wide.
 133	This is to ensure that all services are treated as singletons.
 134	
 135	### Using multiple OpenAPI files / APIs / ApiModules
 136	
 137	In order to use multiple `ApiModules` generated from different OpenAPI files,
 138	you can create an alias name when importing the modules
 139	in order to avoid naming conflicts:
 140	
 141	```typescript
 142	import { ApiModule } from 'my-api-path';
 143	import { ApiModule as OtherApiModule } from 'my-other-api-path';
 144	import { HttpClientModule } from '@angular/common/http';
 145	
 146	@NgModule({
 147	 imports: [
 148	 ApiModule,
 149	 OtherApiModule,
 150	 // make sure to import the HttpClientModule in the AppModule only,
 151	 // see https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/20575
 152	 HttpClientModule
 153	 ]
 154	})
...
 183	export class AppModule {}
 184	```
 185	
 186	### Using @angular/cli
 187	
 188	First extend your `src/environments/*.ts` files by adding the corresponding base path:
 189	
 190	```typescript
 191	export const environment = {
 192	 production: false,
 193	 API_BASE_PATH: 'http://127.0.0.1:8080'
 194	};
 195	```
 196	
 197	In the src/app/app.module.ts:
 198	
 199	```typescript
 200	import { BASE_PATH } from '';
 201	import { environment } from '../environments/environment';
 202	
 203	@NgModule({
 204	 declarations: [
 205	 AppComponent
 206	 ],
 207	 imports: [ ],
 208	 providers: [{ provide: BASE_PATH, useValue: environment.API_BASE_PATH }],
 209	 bootstrap: [ AppComponent ]
 210	})
...

 1	# Getting Started
 2	
 3	### Reference Documentation
 4	For further reference, please consider the following sections:
 5	
 6	* [Official Apache Maven documentation](https://maven.apache.org/guides/index.html)
 7	* [Spring Boot Maven Plugin Reference Guide](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/maven-plugin)
 8	* [Create an OCI image](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/maven-plugin/build-image.html)
 9	* [Spring Web](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/web/servlet.html)
 10	* [Spring Data JPA](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/data/sql.html#data.sql.jpa-and-spring-data)
 11	* [Spring Security](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/web/spring-security.html)
 12	* [Spring Boot Actuator](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/actuator/index.html)
 13	* [Spring Boot DevTools](https://docs.spring.io/spring-boot/3.5.0/reference/using/devtools.html)
 14	
 15	### Guides
 16	The following guides illustrate how to use some features concretely:
 17	
 18	* [Building a RESTful Web Service](https://spring.io/guides/gs/rest-service/)
 19	* [Serving Web Content with Spring MVC](https://spring.io/guides/gs/serving-web-content/)
 20	* [Building REST services with Spring](https://spring.io/guides/tutorials/rest/)
 21	* [Accessing Data with JPA](https://spring.io/guides/gs/accessing-data-jpa/)
 22	* [Securing a Web Application](https://spring.io/guides/gs/securing-web/)
 23	* [Spring Boot and OAuth2](https://spring.io/guides/tutorials/spring-boot-oauth2/)
 24	* [Authenticating a User with LDAP](https://spring.io/guides/gs/authenticating-ldap/)
 25	* [Accessing data with MySQL](https://spring.io/guides/gs/accessing-data-mysql/)
 26	* [Building a RESTful Web Service with Spring Boot Actuator](https://spring.io/guides/gs/actuator-service/)
 27	
 28	### Maven Parent overrides
 29	
 30	Due to Maven's design, elements are inherited from the parent POM to the project POM.
 31	While most of the inheritance is fine, it also inherits unwanted elements like `<license>` and `<developers>` from the parent.
 32	To prevent this, the project POM contains empty overrides for these elements.
 33	If you manually switch to a different parent and actually want the inheritance, you need to remove those overrides.

## User Features

- Sign up: Users can sign up for a new account by providing their personal information,

- Sign in: Users can sign in to their accounts using their email address and password (with lostpassword funcitonality).[25;1H

- Edit profile: Users can edit their profile information, such as name, personal address,
 phone number, birthdate, credit limit.

- Browse products: Users can browse our products and add them to their cart.

- Add to cart: Users can add products to their cart by clicking the "Add to Cart" button.


- Edit cart: Users can edit the quantity of products in their cart or remove products from their cart.

- Add to wishlist
- Edit withlist

[24;120Hentory.

Design PatternsProject Analysis: EComUs E-Commerce Application
Project Structure
The project follows a standard Spring Boot application structure:
Architecture
The application follows a layered architecture:
Presentation Layer (Controllers)
Handles HTTP requests and responses
Input validation
Authentication and authorization
Business Layer (Services)
Core business logic
Transaction management
Domain rules enforcement
Data Access Layer (Repositories)
Database interactions
Query execution
Data persistence
Cross-Cutting Concerns
Security
Logging
Exception handling
Caching
Design Patterns
Repository Pattern
Abstracts data access logic
Spring Data JPA repositories
Specification Pattern
Dynamic query building for filtering products, orders, etc.
ProductSpecification, CartSpecification classes
DTO Pattern
Separates API contracts from domain models
Prevents entity exposure
Builder Pattern
Used in entity and DTO creation
Example: Order.builder() in OrderCreationService
Dependency Injection
Spring's core IoC container
Constructor and field injection
Strategy Pattern
Payment processing strategies
Image storage strategies
Factory Pattern
Creating complex objects
Example: PagingAndSortingHelper
Adapter Pattern
Integration with external services
Example: ImageStorageClient
Technologies Used
Core Framework
Spring Boot 3.5.0
Java 21
Security
Spring Security
JWT Authentication
Role-based access control
Database
MySQL
JPA/Hibernate
Flyway for migrations
Caching
EhCache
JCache API
Hibernate second-level cache
API Documentation
OpenAPI/Swagger
Custom Swagger UI configuration
Storage
Azure Blob Storage
Local file system fallback
Validation
Jakarta Bean Validation
Custom validators
Object Mapping
MapStruct for entity-DTO conversion
Asynchronous Processing
CompletableFuture
Custom thread pools
Async image uploads
Logging
SLF4J
Logback
Key Features
Product Management
CRUD operations
Category management
Image handling
User Management
Authentication
Role-based authorization
Profile management
Shopping Cart
Add/remove items
Quantity management
Price calculation
Order Processing
Checkout flow
Payment processing
Order status tracking
Advanced Search
Dynamic filtering
Pagination
Sorting
Wishlist Management
Save products for later
Move to cart
Payment Processing
Multiple payment methods
Credit limit validation
Design Patterns Used:
Repository Pattern: Spring Data JPA abstraction
Specification Pattern: Dynamic filtering (e.g., ProductSpecification)
DTO Pattern: API contracts, prevent entity exposure
Builder Pattern: Order.builder() style creation
Dependency Injection: Spring IoC (constructor/field)
Strategy Pattern: Payment/Image handling
Factory Pattern: Object creation (e.g., PagingAndSortingHelper)
Adapter Pattern: External integrations (e.g., ImageStorageClient)
# Technologies Used
Our website uses the following technologies:

## Frontend
- angular 20 / guards/ interceptors for jwt token /rxjc

## Backend
Core:
Spring Boot 3.5.0, Java 21
Security:
Spring Security, JWT, role-based access
DB:
MySQL, JPA/Hibernate, Flyway
Caching:
EhCache, JCache, Hibernate L2 cache
Docs & Validation:
OpenAPI/Swagger (custom UI), Jakarta Validation
Storage:
Azure Blob + local fallback
Mapping & Async:
MapStruct, CompletableFuture
Logging:
SLF4J, Logback

 19	
 20	## Consuming
 21	
 22	Navigate to the folder of your consuming project and run one of next commands.
 23	
 24	_published:_
 25	
 26	```console
 27	npm install @ --save
 28	```
 29	
 30	_without publishing (not recommended):_
 31	
 32	```console
 33	npm install PATH_TO_GENERATED_PACKAGE/dist.tgz --save
 34	```
 35	
 36	_It's important to take the tgz file, otherwise you'll get trouble with links on windows_
 37	
 38	_using `npm link`:_
 39	
 40	In PATH_TO_GENERATED_PACKAGE/dist:
 41	
 42	```console
 43	npm link
 44	```
